TopicTitle: Kennedy Space Center and the Delta IV

Articles.Content:
I'll be going to the Kennedy Space Center for a good part of the week [starting later today]. I've decided to finally buy a camera for this!

Kennedy is planning to launch a GPS [Global Positioning Satellite] in roughly 2 days on an Atlas V rocket. Is anyone else going for the occasion? If so, I hope I get to see you!

EDIT: Well, next week there will be a Delta IV launch, so I'll be able to go to that.

Hey! You there! Yeah, you. You better expect some videos!

In the meantime, why not have some discussions above?

EDIT: Let's take a few moments to recount the history of the IIF.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VWPqwpBiruo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

EDIT: Well, I may not be able to go for another day or two. Brenden called me and needed a ride to the hospital earlier, so I need to stay and make sure he's okay.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-13T19:18:05Z" title="07/13/2015 07:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 13, 2015</time> by Xannari Ferrows**
I live 20 hours away by car, so sadly, I will not see the launch.

Do \_not\_[go swimming](http://www.space.com/22772-frog-photobombs-nasa-moon-launch.html)there!

Do \_not\_ [hug](http://www.space.com/6442-bat-hung-ride-space.html) anything that's orange and huge!

Have fun and return with pictures! :-)
I'll have to delay this a few days. Brenden is still recovering. I will go to see the Delta IV launch though. Don't go away!
When is the Delta IV launch? I might go too. I'm pretty close in Jacksonville. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> When is the Delta IV launch? I might go too. I'm pretty close in Jacksonville. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's scheduled for 07/22 at 8:07.

> 
> It's scheduled for 07/22 at 8:07.

Thanks! Gonna see if I can make it.

Launch happened a day later than scheduled, and I got videos and pictures on the way! It'll take the rest of the night to format everything correctly [and warning: The videos are low quality, but I could only afford a 4800t camera. The pictures turned out good though.
Can't wait to see them!

I've got it all ready! The videos are uploading now, and the pictures are all ready to go! I recommend viewing the album on the website itself, but the extension will be here regardless.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/7v3VL)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-26T04:58:06Z" title="07/26/2015 04:58  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 26, 2015</time> by Xannari Ferrows**
Nice! Thanks for sharing! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Well, I've got the up to a different player, so here are the actual videos!

Launch: [bad camera. Sorry, but I only had 4800t]

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RZtduN-28Kw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Saturn V and a touch on the Apollo missions:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/bGVs-pYV2b0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
I \*have\* to visit there at some point. Great pics, Xannari.
You have to, and you should. Earplugs not included.

> 
> You have to, and you should. Earplugs not included.

Did you have fun?

> 
> Did you have fun?

Got a few pics, ate food I waited 2 hours for, nearly had my ears blown out, got security called on me multiple times...

Yup, I'd say fun.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-27T18:29:36Z" title="07/27/2015 06:29  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 27, 2015</time> by Xannari Ferrows**
wooooo oooo ooooo ; )

> 
> got security called on my multiple times...

Do i really want to know why?

> 
> Do i really want to know why?

I can't read, alright? I can't understand these words. I don't even know what the guys at mission control are saying.
Aaaahhhh....

man i miss living down their:(. I got to watch shuttle launches, and multiple delta rocket launches (a lot of the delta II ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif))
